intro: Retanilla trinervia, commonly known as the three-veined nettle, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many species of stinging plants. The plant is characterized by its small, green, heart-shaped leaves with three prominent veins. It produces tiny greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, and it is often found in moist, shaded environments. Retanilla trinervia is known for its stinging hairs, which can cause skin irritation upon contact.
